segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're going to have a fun, funny lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们将进行一堂有趣的课程。

segments.en: That's right.
So I think this lesson is going to be a little bit different than most of our lessons, right?
segments.cn: 我认为这节课会与我们大多数课程有所不同，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
Today we're going to be looking at jokes, which is a very important part of English speaking culture.
segments.cn: 今天我们将讨论笑话，这是英语口语文化中非常重要的一部分。

segments.en: Yeah, so we're actually going to teach you a few pretty hilarious jokes.
segments.cn: 是的，我们实际上会教你几个非常搞笑的笑话。

segments.en: But we're also going to teach you some language related to jokes, funny things, and that sort of stuff.
segments.cn: 但我们也会教你一些与笑话、搞笑事物相关的语言。

segments.en: Alright, so in order for us to understand a little bit better the jokes that we're going to be looking at, why don't we take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好吧，为了更好地理解我们要看的笑话，为什么不先看看词汇预览呢？

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
Two of these words you'll hear in the dialogue, but one you won't, but you still need to know this word so you can understand the jokes.
segments.cn: 这几个词中有两个你会在对话中听到，但有一个你不会听到，但你仍然需要知道这个词，以便理解笑话。

segments.en: Alright, so the word that we're talking about is not really a word, it's a sound.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们要讨论的这个词其实不是一个词，而是一个声音。

segments.en: Yeah.
Moo.
Moo.
So moo is the sound that cows make.
segments.cn: 所以哞是牛发出的声音。

segments.en: That's right, m-o-o.
Right, they go moo.
Very nice, Marco.
I could do a good cow.
Yep.
Alright, so we all know now that that's what cows say.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们现在都知道牛是这样说的。

segments.en: Exactly, so it's going to be important for the joke, you'll see why.
segments.cn: 正是，所以这对笑话很重要，你会明白为什么。

segments.en: Okay, now another word that you need to understand is a dam.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你需要理解的另一个词是“坝”。

segments.en: So a dam.
A dam.
A dam is a, is a dam.
Is like a big wall, right?
Well, it's a wall in water that stops the river from flowing.
segments.cn: 嗯，它是水中的一堵墙，阻止河流流动。

segments.en: Okay, so usually you build dams in rivers and then the water can pass or not.
segments.cn: 好吧，通常你在河里建坝，然后水可以通过或不通过。

segments.en: Yeah, it's something that you use to generate electricity, right?
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种用来发电的东西，对吧？

segments.en: Very good.
But there's another word that sounds exactly the same way, but it's just spelled a little differently.
segments.cn: 但还有另一个发音完全相同的词，只是拼写稍有不同。

segments.en: That's right, and we might hear someone say, oh, dam.
segments.cn: 没错，我们可能会听到有人说，哦，坝。

segments.en: And that's an interjection which basically means... Oh no!
segments.cn: 这是一个感叹词，基本上意味着……哦，不！

segments.en: Right.
That's terrible.
Yeah.
Dam, I can say, dam, I forgot my keys.
segments.cn: 坝，我可以说，坝，我忘记带钥匙了。

segments.en: Dam, we're late for the movie.
Okay, so it's an interesting interjection and we'll also see it in one of our jokes.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个有趣的感叹词，我们也会在我们的一个笑话中看到它。

segments.en: And now let's move on to our last word.
segments.cn: 现在让我们继续看最后一个词。

segments.en: Nostrils.
Okay, nostrils.
Nostrils.
So a nostril or your nostrils... The two holes in your nose.
segments.cn: 所以鼻孔或你的鼻孔……你鼻子上的两个孔。

segments.en: Right, you breathe through your nostrils.
Alright, so now that we've taken a look at these three words, why don't we listen to our comedian for the first time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们已经看过这三个词，为什么不听听我们的喜剧演员第一次表演，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Hello everyone and welcome to Open Mic Night.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到开放麦克风之夜。

segments.en: You're in for a real treat as we've got a lot of great comics here with us tonight.
segments.cn: 你们将享受到真正的盛宴，因为今晚我们有很多优秀的喜剧演员。

segments.en: First up, we have a very funny man coming straight from the state of Montana, Robert Hicks.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有一位非常搞笑的男士，来自蒙大拿州，Robert Hicks。

segments.en: Thank you everyone.
Well, what a lovely crowd.
You know, there's nothing I love better than stand-up comedy.
segments.cn: 你知道，我最喜欢的就是单口喜剧。

segments.en: You know, I've been working on my routine for months now and I've got some real zingers for you tonight.
segments.cn: 我已经为我的表演准备了几个月，今晚我有一些真正的精彩笑话要给你们。

segments.en: Let's start out with some short jokes.
segments.cn: 让我们先从一些短笑话开始。

segments.en: How about that?
Where do you find a one-legged dog?
segments.cn: 你在哪里能找到一只独腿的狗？

segments.en: Where you left it.
Get it?
Anyways, what do you call a sheep with no legs?
segments.cn: 不管怎样，你怎么称呼一只没有腿的羊？

segments.en: A cloud.
Tough crowd.
Alright, now you're gonna love this joke.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你会喜欢这个笑话。

segments.en: It's hilarious.
What do cows do for entertainment?
They rent movies.
Movies.
Okay, okay, okay, we've got a few hecklers in the audience, but this one is good.
segments.cn: 好吧，好吧，好吧，观众中有几个捣乱者，但这个笑话很好。

segments.en: What does a fish say when it runs into a wall?
Damn!
Okay, okay, okay, last one.
segments.cn: 好吧，好吧，好吧，最后一个。

segments.en: Why do gorillas have big nostrils?
segments.cn: 为什么大猩猩有大鼻孔？

segments.en: Because they got big fingers.
Thanks everyone, that was my time.
segments.cn: 谢谢大家，这就是我的时间。

segments.en: Okay, so some pretty hilarious jokes, huh?
segments.cn: 好吧，一些非常搞笑的笑话，是吧？

segments.en: I don't think the crowd really enjoyed them all that much.
segments.cn: 我觉得观众并没有那么享受。

segments.en: Okay, well maybe I'm just a fan of really terrible jokes.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许我只是喜欢真正糟糕的笑话。

segments.en: Well, they were pretty funny, but I guess the crowd just didn't appreciate his sense of humor.
segments.cn: 嗯，他们确实很搞笑，但我想观众只是没有欣赏他的幽默感。

segments.en: But you know what?
They did use quite a lot of really interesting language, so why don't we look at that now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 他们确实使用了很多非常有趣的语言，所以我们现在来看看语言要点。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
On Language Takeaway, we're gonna be looking at six words today, so let's get started.
segments.cn: 在语言要点中，我们今天将看六个词，所以让我们开始吧。

segments.en: The announcer welcomed everyone and said that it's open mic night.
segments.cn: 主持人欢迎大家，并说这是开放麦克风之夜。

segments.en: Open mic night.
So an open mic night.
Okay, well we know mic is short for microphone, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们知道“麦克”是“麦克风”的缩写，对吧？

segments.en: Now an open mic night is a chance where anyone can come up and talk into the microphone.
segments.cn: 现在开放麦克风之夜是一个机会，任何人都可以上台对着麦克风说话。

segments.en: So you can come up and sing or you can tell jokes, you can do anything basically.
segments.cn: 所以你可以上来唱歌，或者讲笑话，基本上你可以做任何事情。

segments.en: Yeah.
All right, open mic.
So it's not for professionals but for people who maybe want to be professionals.
segments.cn: 所以这不是给专业人士的，而是给那些可能想成为专业人士的人。

segments.en: Right, amateurs.
So it was open mic night and he said they had a lot of great comics there.
segments.cn: 所以这是开放麦克风之夜，他说他们那里有很多优秀的喜剧演员。

segments.en: So comics.
A comic.
A comic.
So basically a comic is a person that makes a living by making people laugh.
segments.cn: 基本上，喜剧演员是通过让人们笑来谋生的人。

segments.en: Yeah, someone who stands up on stage and tells jokes.
segments.cn: 是的，站在舞台上讲笑话的人。

segments.en: All right.
Would you say a clown is kind of like a comic?
segments.cn: 你会说小丑有点像喜剧演员吗？

segments.en: No, they're different.
They're different, right?
A comic doesn't wear a red nose and a crazy costume.
segments.cn: 喜剧演员不穿红鼻子和疯狂的服装。

segments.en: Yeah.
All right.
Yeah, because I hate clowns.
We do know that about you.
All right, so a comic.
And what comics do is they perform a stand-up comedy.
segments.cn: 喜剧演员做的是表演单口喜剧。

segments.en: Stand-up comedy.
Stand-up comedy.
Okay, so stand-up comedy is really exactly what its name suggests, right?
segments.cn: 好的，单口喜剧确实正如其名，对吧？

segments.en: Right, you stand up in front of an audience and you tell jokes and or you make them laugh.
segments.cn: 对，你站在观众面前，讲笑话或让他们笑。

segments.en: Yeah, tell funny stories.
It's a very popular form of entertainment in the United States and the UK.
segments.cn: 这在美国和英国是一种非常受欢迎的娱乐形式。

segments.en: That's right.
And I think we'll talk a little bit more about that at the end of the lesson.
segments.cn: 我想我们会在课程结束时再多谈谈这个。

segments.en: But why don't we move on to our next word, which is routine.
segments.cn: 但我们为什么不继续下一个单词，例行公事。

segments.en: A routine.
So the guy says, I've been working on my routine.
segments.cn: 所以那个人说，我一直在练习我的例行公事。

segments.en: So what does he mean by his routine?
segments.cn: 那么他所说的例行公事是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, I guess a routine is like a series or a collection of jokes or maybe movements that you use in a performance.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想例行公事就像是一系列或一组笑话，或者在表演中使用的动作。

segments.en: All right, a routine.
So you can talk about a dance routine or in this case, a comedy routine.
segments.cn: 所以你可以谈论舞蹈例行公事，或者在这种情况下，喜剧例行公事。

segments.en: So the series of jokes he's going to tell.
segments.cn: 所以他要讲的一系列笑话。

segments.en: That's right.
That he practices again and again and again.
All right.
And in his routine, he said he's got a lot of zingers.
segments.cn: 在他的例行公事中，他说他有很多精彩的笑话。

segments.en: Zingers.
A zinger.
So what's a zinger?
segments.cn: 那么什么是精彩的笑话？

segments.en: Basically, a zinger is like a strong, maybe a little bit rude joke.
segments.cn: 基本上，精彩的笑话是一种强烈的，可能有点粗鲁的笑话。

segments.en: Yeah, but like a kind of a one line joke, right?
segments.cn: 是的，但像是一句笑话，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
Yeah.
And the people that were in the crowd and they were booing him.
segments.cn: 在人群中的人们在对他嘘声。

segments.en: They're like boo.
Those we call hecklers.
segments.cn: 我们称这些人为捣乱者。

segments.en: Exactly.
And that's the last word.
A heckler.
A heckler.
Hecklers.
So let's listen to some hecklers in action.
segments.cn: 所以让我们听听一些捣乱者的表现。

segments.en: All right, well, I think that's pretty clear.
Those are definitely hecklers.
Right.
They're very annoying.
So now that we've finished looking at all the words that are related to comedy and performances, let's take a look at the jokes now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们已经看完了与喜剧和表演相关的所有单词，让我们看看流利构建器中的笑话。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Okay, well, we're not really focusing on on new phrases for you here, but we thought it would be helpful to talk a little bit about the jokes to help you understand them, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们并不真的专注于这里的新短语，但我们认为谈谈笑话会对你理解它们有帮助，对吧？

segments.en: Because they are, well, I think pretty funny.
segments.cn: 因为它们，我认为相当有趣。

segments.en: Yeah, they're pretty funny, but maybe sometimes they're kind of hard to understand.
segments.cn: 是的，它们相当有趣，但有时可能有点难以理解。

segments.en: So why don't we start with the first joke?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不从第一个笑话开始？

segments.en: So you said, where do you find a one legged dog?
So what's a one legged dog?
Basically, it's a dog that has one leg.
segments.cn: 基本上，它是一只只有一条腿的狗。

segments.en: Okay.
And the pronunciation here is important, right?
segments.cn: 这里的发音很重要，对吧？

segments.en: One legged.
Not one legged.
No.
One legged.
So you can say a one legged dog, a two legged dog or a three legged dog.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说单腿狗，双腿狗或三条腿狗。

segments.en: Six legged dog?
A six legged spider maybe lost two legs in a war.
segments.cn: 六条腿的蜘蛛可能在战争中失去了两条腿。

segments.en: Oh dear.
Okay, so the dog obviously didn't go anywhere and so that's why you find it where you left it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以狗显然没有去任何地方，所以你会在你放下它的地方找到它。

segments.en: Exactly.
So that's why it's kind of funny.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么它有点好笑。

segments.en: Okay.
All right.
So then he said, what do you call a sheep with no legs?
segments.cn: 然后他说，你称没有腿的羊为什么？

segments.en: I don't know.
A cloud.
Basically, because you know sheep are fluffy and they're white.
segments.cn: 基本上，因为你知道羊是蓬松的，白色的。

segments.en: So if you take away their legs, they look like a little cloud.
segments.cn: 所以如果你去掉它们的腿，它们看起来像一朵小云。

segments.en: All right, let's look at the next one.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个。

segments.en: He asked, what do cows do for entertainment?
And then the answer was they rent movies.
segments.cn: 然后答案是他们租电影。

segments.en: Exactly.
So it's kind of funny because he's relating this word movies with what the sound that cows make, which is moo.
segments.cn: 所以这有点好笑，因为他将这个词电影与牛发出的声音联系在一起，那就是哞。

segments.en: Right.
And actually there are a million jokes in English following the same pattern, right?
segments.cn: 实际上，英语中有一百万个笑话遵循相同的模式，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
So I'm sure you can find a lot more of them and you can share them with us.
segments.cn: 所以我相信你可以找到更多的笑话，并与我们分享。

segments.en: Now, my personal favorite joke is the guy says, what does a fish say when it runs into a wall?
segments.cn: 现在，我个人最喜欢的笑话是那个人说，鱼撞墙时说什么？

segments.en: So to run into a wall basically is to crash against the wall.
segments.cn: 所以撞墙基本上是撞上墙。

segments.en: Yeah.
So what does the fish say?
Damn.
So why is this funny?
Why does it say damn?
Well, because I mean, if you're a person and you run into a wall, damn, like that, you know, just like, Oh no.
segments.cn: 嗯，因为我的意思是，如果你是一个人，撞上墙，天哪，就像那样，你知道，就像，哦不。

segments.en: Yeah.
But a fish is swimming under the water.
And like we saw a dam is actually like a wall in the water.
segments.cn: 我们看到的水坝实际上就像水中的墙。

segments.en: So he's saying like a wall.
Yeah.
Yeah.
So it's that I like that one.
All right.
The last one was pretty good.
Why do gorillas have big nostrils?
segments.cn: 为什么大猩猩有大鼻孔？

segments.en: Okay.
So the big holes in their nose, right?
segments.cn: 所以他们鼻子上的大洞，对吧？

segments.en: And basically it's because they have big fingers so they can put their fingers in the nose.
segments.cn: 基本上是因为他们有大手指，所以可以把手指放进鼻子里。

segments.en: Exactly.
If the gorilla didn't have big nostrils, he wouldn't be able to pick his nose.
segments.cn: 如果大猩猩没有大鼻孔，他就不能挖鼻子。

segments.en: Maybe he'd have to use a stick, but that wouldn't be convenient.
segments.cn: 也许他得用棍子，但那不方便。

segments.en: See?
All right.
So that's why those jokes are funny.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么那些笑话有趣。

segments.en: They're very short jokes.
segments.cn: 它们都是非常简短的笑话。

segments.en: Some, of course, some of them are not actually really funny, but, uh, it's just a little bit of a taste of short American jokes.
segments.cn: 当然，有些并不真的好笑，但，呃，这只是短小的美国笑话的一个小品味。

segments.en: Okay.
Well, I think we need to hear them one more time in context.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我们需要再听一遍它们的上下文。

segments.en: So, um, you can all know how funny or maybe not so funny.
segments.cn: 这样，嗯，你们都可以知道它们有多好笑，或者可能不那么好笑。

segments.en: They are.
Hello, everyone, and welcome to Open Mic Night.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到开放麦克风之夜。

segments.en: You're in for a real treat as we've got a lot of great comics here with us tonight.
segments.cn: 今晚你们将享受到真正的乐趣，因为我们有很多优秀的喜剧演员在这里。

segments.en: First up, we have a very funny man coming straight from the state of Montana, Robert Hicks.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有一位非常搞笑的男士，来自蒙大拿州，罗伯特·希克斯。

segments.en: Thank you, everyone.
Well, what a lovely crowd.
You know, there's nothing I love better than stand-up comedy.
segments.cn: 你知道，我最喜欢的就是单口喜剧。

segments.en: You know, I've been working on my routine for months now, and I've got some real zingers for you tonight.
segments.cn: 你知道，我已经为我的节目准备了几个月，今晚我有一些真正的精彩段子给你们。

segments.en: Let's start out with some short jokes.
segments.cn: 让我们先从一些简短的笑话开始。

segments.en: How about that?
Where do you find a one-legged dog?
segments.cn: 你在哪里能找到一只独腿的狗？

segments.en: Where you left it?
Get it?
Anyways, what do you call a sheep with no legs?
segments.cn: 不管怎样，你怎么称呼一只没有腿的羊？

segments.en: A cloud.
A tough crowd.
All right, now you're gonna love this joke.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你会喜欢这个笑话。

segments.en: It's hilarious.
What do cows do for entertainment?
They rent movies.
Movies.
Okay, okay, okay, we've got a, okay, we've got a few hecklers in the audience, but this one is good.
segments.cn: 好的，好的，好的，我们有一些观众在起哄，但这个很好。

segments.en: What does a fish say when it runs into a wall?
Damn!
Okay, okay, okay, last one.
segments.cn: 好的，好的，好的，最后一个。

segments.en: Why do gorillas have big nostrils?
segments.cn: 为什么大猩猩有大鼻孔？

segments.en: Because they got big fingers!
Thanks everyone, that was my time.
segments.cn: 谢谢大家，这就是我的时间。

segments.en: Now if you have any good jokes of your own, why don't you come to our website and tell us about them?
segments.cn: 如果你有任何好的笑话，为什么不来我们的网站告诉我们呢？

segments.en: Right, come to EnglishPod.com, share with us any jokes.
segments.cn: 对，来EnglishPod.com，和我们分享任何笑话。

segments.en: Of course they have to be clean, don't come when you're... Yeah, no, no swears.
segments.cn: 当然，它们必须是干净的，不要来这里... 是的，不，不要骂人。

segments.en: No swearing in the jokes.
Yep.
All right, so we'll see you guys there and until next time.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们在那儿见，直到下次。

segments.en: Thanks for listening and goodbye!
